<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://Rook-io.slack.com).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:Failure in deploying OSD via Cluster CRD**

**Expected behavior: Successful deployment of the Cluster CRD**

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise): Use kops to setup kubernetes on AWS and try to install rook 0.8.2**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Debain Jessi (kops stable channel)
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.4.148-k8s
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: AWS
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): 0.8.2
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.10.8
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): AWS using Kops
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/Rook/master/toolbox.html)):

![screenshot from 2018-09-21 20-53-26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12831254/45890446-9a121380-bde0-11e8-89fc-1922f2c6a1ee.png)
However, my label looks like: `kubernetes.io/hostname=ip-172-10-87-82`

milestone.description:
* Multiple storage backends
  * Full design
  * Refactor code base and repositories to enable
  * Consider support for Minio, potentially early support for other backends time permitting
* Switch CRDs to API Aggregation
* Run on arbitrary PVs
* Remove Rook API and CLI
* Migrate CI and release pipelines to a solution hosted by the CNCF
* Run with Least Privileged and possibly without privileged containers
* Shutdown / restart issues
* Support Kubernetes 1.7+ only
* Ceph features and improvements
  * Adding/removing disks (lifecycle issues, failures, 1 OSD per pod, etc.)
  * Placement group balancer support (ceph-mgr module)
  * Mon reliability (restarts, failing over too fast, ip changes, etc.)
  * Mimic support

title: Mismatch between kubernetes.io/hostname label between nodes and Cluster CRD
